comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: This is a photo of the father - Lieutenant Colonel Lord John Pakenham Joicey-Cecil, formerly Cecil (3 March 1867 – 25 June 1942), who was British Conservative politician for Stamford, Lincolnshire. Lieut.-Col. and Hon. Col 4th Batt. Lincolnshire Regt.(Newton Hall, Stocksfield-on-Tyne), formerly Lieut. Gren. Guards. Youngest of nine children. Older brothers Brownlow Cecil, 4th Marquess of Exeter (1849-1898) and William Cecil (1854-1943) also served in the Grenadier Guards. www.archive.org/stream/houseofcecil00denn/houseofcecil00d... p.144 www.thepeerage.com/p6473.htm#i64721 Supplement to the London Gazette, 3 May, 1918 www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30666/supplements/5351/pa... Royal Defence Corps temp. Lt-Col. J. P. Joicey-Cecil, temp. Capt. Gren. Gds., (Hon Col., ret., Militia) (Hon. Maj. in Army) relinquishes his position in the T.F. on ceasing to be empld. 31st Mar. 1918. Lord John Pakenham Joicey-Cecil's soldier son, Lieutenant John Francis James Joicey-Cecil, 4th Battalion Grenadier Guards (18 September 1897 - 25 September 1916) died in WW1. www.thepeerage.com/p28289.htm#i282889 Another son, Edward Wilfred George Joicey-Cecil (14 January 1912 - 6 October 1985) married Rosemary Lusia Bowes-Lyon, (daughter of Fergus and granddaughter of Claude George Bowes-Lyon, 14th Earl of Strathmore), on 28 April 1945. Lusia's aunt was Elizabeth, Bowes-Lyon, the Queen Mother. www.thepeerage.com/p10080.htm#i100792 www.thepeerage.com/p5457.htm#i54564

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Lieutenant John Francis James Joicey-Cecil, 4th Battalion Grenadier Guards (18 September 1897 - 25 September 1916) is buried at the Guards' Cemetery, 1 kilometre SW of the village of Lesboeufs in the Somme. The Guards Division attacked the village on the 15th September 1916, and it was captured by them on the 25th. The fighting in 1916 is commemorated by the Guards Division Memorial situated along the road to Ginchy. Pictures of the Guards cemetery www.ww1battlefields.co.uk/somme/guillemont.html Joicey-Cecil, J F J Grave twgpp.org/information.php?id=3154628
